Meet people, make friends and speak a lot of language with BlaBla Cairo
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------
\r\n HOW OUR EVENTS WORK 
\r\n It's very easy.
\r\nWe always start our events in  English and / or the local language. Then, once two or three people want to speak the same language, it will be possible to create a new linguistic group. For example if 2 or 3 people wish to speak French, we will create a group in  French .
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Yes, you can arrive late! Maximum 45min after the start of the event. However, being on time is greatly appreciated.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Our events are free; however, each participant shares in the space's rent.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 /  By participating in our events, you agree to be photographed and / or filmed. The photos and videos will be shared on our social networks and may be used for commercial purposes. You can also post your own photos with the #BlaBlaSelfie and #BlaBlaLanguageExchange HTag
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 This event does not welcome children, even accompanied by parents

Folklorita: Reviving Egyptian Heritage @ MASQ

\r\n\r\n

 Date: Saturday, 18 January 2024
\r\n Time: 4:00 PM – 5:00 PM
\r\n Location: Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey

\r\n\r\n

Join us for an enchanting evening of traditional Egyptian music as Folklorita takes the stage at the historic Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey. This concert is part of the "Heritage for the People" series, celebrating the fusion of heritage and community development.

\r\n\r\n

Folklorita, an Egyptian musical ensemble founded in 2024, breathes new life into traditional folklore with a contemporary twist. Their performances have garnered acclaim for revitalising Egypt's rich musical heritage.

\r\n\r\n

The Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey, a historic Sufi complex from 1519-1524, was restored by ARCHiNOS in 2018-2019 with EU funding. Now is part of MASQ (Multicultural and Artistic Space at Qaitbey's) and operated by the Sultan Foundation, it serves as a cultural hub hosting Egyptian and international arts events alongside community programs.

\r\n\r\n

Don't miss this unique opportunity to experience the harmonious blend of Egypt's musical traditions within a historic setting. Mark your calendars and join us for an unforgettable cultural experience.

Dear Family's and friends

\r\n\r\n

HAPPY NEW YEAR 2025

\r\n\r\n

We are pleased to announce the grand opening of our new guest house, the Pyramids Temple Guest House. We have put in a lot of effort and thought into creating a place that offers comfort, convenience, and a touch of Egyptian charm.

\r\n\r\n

We would be honored if you could join us for the opening party on 31 Dec 2024, from 9 pm to 1 Am.
\r\nWe promise an evening of good company, delicious Egyptian sweets, and refreshing beverages, including water and soft drinks. You are also welcome to bring along any drink with you.

\r\n\r\n

Feel free to extend this invitation to your family and friends. The more, the merrier!

\r\n\r\n

We look forward to welcoming you to our guest house and sharing a memorable evening of New Year 2025

\r\n\r\n

Best Regards
\r\nPyramids Temple Guest House

", "address": null, "days": null, "platform": null, "format": false, "is_active": true, "cancellation_policy": null, "view_count": 10, "created_at": "2024-12-24T22:09:05.000000Z", "updated_at": "2025-01-11T11:19:58.000000Z" }, { "id": 61, "category_id": 39, "sub_category_id": null, "city_id": 14, "currency_id": 5, "company_id": null, "ad_fee_id": null, "name": "NVICinema : The Children Behind Zalaga", "upload_by": "myevnt", "organized_by": "NVIC - Netherlands-Flemish Institute in Cairo", "location": "1, Dr. Mahmoud Azmi Street, Zamalek, Egypt, 11211", "description": "

The Children Behind Zalaga

\r\n\r\n

A Documentary by Karim Ali | 2023 | 65 min | Egypt | In Arabic with English subtitles

\r\n\r\n

Every year in South Sinai, young jockeys are chosen to compete in the Zalaga race—the oldest camel race in Egypt. This gripping documentary offers an intimate look at the child camel racers of South Sinai, highlighting the centuries-old Bedouin tradition that fuels their dreams of success. From wealthy investors to skilled trainers, and young jockeys who sacrifice their education for financial support, witness the highs and lows of the camel racing industry through their eyes.

\r\n\r\n

Karim Ali is a documentary filmmaker who studied Media Management at the Arab Academy for Science, Technology, and Maritime Transport in Alexandria, Egypt. His debut short film, Airplane Mode (2017), was set in Dahab, South Sinai. His second documentary, The Children Behind Zalaga (2023), has been selected for the IDFA Festival 2023 and Vision du Réel 2024.

\r\n\r\n

Dear Family's and friends

\r\n\r\n

HAPPY NEW YEAR 2025

\r\n\r\n

We are pleased to announce the grand opening of our new guest house, the Pyramids Temple Guest House. We have put in a lot of effort and thought into creating a place that offers comfort, convenience, and a touch of Egyptian charm.

\r\n\r\n

We would be honored if you could join us for the opening party on 31 Dec 2024, from 9 pm to 1 Am.
\r\nWe promise an evening of good company, delicious Egyptian sweets, and refreshing beverages, including water and soft drinks. You are also welcome to bring along any drink with you.

\r\n\r\n

Feel free to extend this invitation to your family and friends. The more, the merrier!

\r\n\r\n

We look forward to welcoming you to our guest house and sharing a memorable evening of New Year 2025

\r\n\r\n

Best Regards
\r\nPyramids Temple Guest House

", "address": null, "days": null, "platform": null, "format": false, "is_active": true, "cancellation_policy": null, "view_count": 10, "created_at": "2024-12-24T22:09:05.000000Z", "updated_at": "2025-01-11T11:19:58.000000Z" }, { "id": 61, "category_id": 39, "sub_category_id": null, "city_id": 14, "currency_id": 5, "company_id": null, "ad_fee_id": null, "name": "NVICinema : The Children Behind Zalaga", "upload_by": "myevnt", "organized_by": "NVIC - Netherlands-Flemish Institute in Cairo", "location": "1, Dr. Mahmoud Azmi Street, Zamalek, Egypt, 11211", "description": "

The Children Behind Zalaga

\r\n\r\n

A Documentary by Karim Ali | 2023 | 65 min | Egypt | In Arabic with English subtitles

\r\n\r\n

Every year in South Sinai, young jockeys are chosen to compete in the Zalaga race—the oldest camel race in Egypt. This gripping documentary offers an intimate look at the child camel racers of South Sinai, highlighting the centuries-old Bedouin tradition that fuels their dreams of success. From wealthy investors to skilled trainers, and young jockeys who sacrifice their education for financial support, witness the highs and lows of the camel racing industry through their eyes.

\r\n\r\n

Karim Ali is a documentary filmmaker who studied Media Management at the Arab Academy for Science, Technology, and Maritime Transport in Alexandria, Egypt. His debut short film, Airplane Mode (2017), was set in Dahab, South Sinai. His second documentary, The Children Behind Zalaga (2023), has been selected for the IDFA Festival 2023 and Vision du Réel 2024.

\r\n\r\n

\r\n HOW OUR EVENTS WORK 
\r\n It's very easy.
\r\nWe always start our events in  English and / or the local language. Then, once two or three people want to speak the same language, it will be possible to create a new linguistic group. For example if 2 or 3 people wish to speak French, we will create a group in  French .
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Yes, you can arrive late! Maximum 45min after the start of the event. However, being on time is greatly appreciated.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Our events are free; however, each participant shares in the space's rent.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 /  By participating in our events, you agree to be photographed and / or filmed. The photos and videos will be shared on our social networks and may be used for commercial purposes. You can also post your own photos with the #BlaBlaSelfie and #BlaBlaLanguageExchange HTag
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 This event does not welcome children, even accompanied by parents

The Children Behind Zalaga

\r\n\r\n

A Documentary by Karim Ali | 2023 | 65 min | Egypt | In Arabic with English subtitles

\r\n\r\n

Every year in South Sinai, young jockeys are chosen to compete in the Zalaga race—the oldest camel race in Egypt. This gripping documentary offers an intimate look at the child camel racers of South Sinai, highlighting the centuries-old Bedouin tradition that fuels their dreams of success. From wealthy investors to skilled trainers, and young jockeys who sacrifice their education for financial support, witness the highs and lows of the camel racing industry through their eyes.

\r\n\r\n

Karim Ali is a documentary filmmaker who studied Media Management at the Arab Academy for Science, Technology, and Maritime Transport in Alexandria, Egypt. His debut short film, Airplane Mode (2017), was set in Dahab, South Sinai. His second documentary, The Children Behind Zalaga (2023), has been selected for the IDFA Festival 2023 and Vision du Réel 2024.

\r\n\r\n

Meet people, make friends and speak a lot of language with BlaBla Cairo
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------
\r\n HOW OUR EVENTS WORK 
\r\n It's very easy.
\r\nWe always start our events in  English and / or the local language. Then, once two or three people want to speak the same language, it will be possible to create a new linguistic group. For example if 2 or 3 people wish to speak French, we will create a group in  French .
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Yes, you can arrive late! Maximum 45min after the start of the event. However, being on time is greatly appreciated.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Our events are free; however, each participant shares in the space's rent.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 /  By participating in our events, you agree to be photographed and / or filmed. The photos and videos will be shared on our social networks and may be used for commercial purposes. You can also post your own photos with the #BlaBlaSelfie and #BlaBlaLanguageExchange HTag
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 This event does not welcome children, even accompanied by parents

Dear Family's and friends

\r\n\r\n

HAPPY NEW YEAR 2025

\r\n\r\n

We are pleased to announce the grand opening of our new guest house, the Pyramids Temple Guest House. We have put in a lot of effort and thought into creating a place that offers comfort, convenience, and a touch of Egyptian charm.

\r\n\r\n

We would be honored if you could join us for the opening party on 31 Dec 2024, from 9 pm to 1 Am.
\r\nWe promise an evening of good company, delicious Egyptian sweets, and refreshing beverages, including water and soft drinks. You are also welcome to bring along any drink with you.

\r\n\r\n

Feel free to extend this invitation to your family and friends. The more, the merrier!

\r\n\r\n

We look forward to welcoming you to our guest house and sharing a memorable evening of New Year 2025

\r\n\r\n

Best Regards
\r\nPyramids Temple Guest House

The Children Behind Zalaga

\r\n\r\n

A Documentary by Karim Ali | 2023 | 65 min | Egypt | In Arabic with English subtitles

\r\n\r\n

Every year in South Sinai, young jockeys are chosen to compete in the Zalaga race—the oldest camel race in Egypt. This gripping documentary offers an intimate look at the child camel racers of South Sinai, highlighting the centuries-old Bedouin tradition that fuels their dreams of success. From wealthy investors to skilled trainers, and young jockeys who sacrifice their education for financial support, witness the highs and lows of the camel racing industry through their eyes.

\r\n\r\n

Karim Ali is a documentary filmmaker who studied Media Management at the Arab Academy for Science, Technology, and Maritime Transport in Alexandria, Egypt. His debut short film, Airplane Mode (2017), was set in Dahab, South Sinai. His second documentary, The Children Behind Zalaga (2023), has been selected for the IDFA Festival 2023 and Vision du Réel 2024.

\r\n\r\n

\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------
\r\n HOW OUR EVENTS WORK 
\r\n It's very easy.
\r\nWe always start our events in  English and / or the local language. Then, once two or three people want to speak the same language, it will be possible to create a new linguistic group. For example if 2 or 3 people wish to speak French, we will create a group in  French .
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Yes, you can arrive late! Maximum 45min after the start of the event. However, being on time is greatly appreciated.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Our events are free; however, each participant shares in the space's rent.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 /  By participating in our events, you agree to be photographed and / or filmed. The photos and videos will be shared on our social networks and may be used for commercial purposes. You can also post your own photos with the #BlaBlaSelfie and #BlaBlaLanguageExchange HTag
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 This event does not welcome children, even accompanied by parents

The Children Behind Zalaga

\r\n\r\n

A Documentary by Karim Ali | 2023 | 65 min | Egypt | In Arabic with English subtitles

\r\n\r\n

Every year in South Sinai, young jockeys are chosen to compete in the Zalaga race—the oldest camel race in Egypt. This gripping documentary offers an intimate look at the child camel racers of South Sinai, highlighting the centuries-old Bedouin tradition that fuels their dreams of success. From wealthy investors to skilled trainers, and young jockeys who sacrifice their education for financial support, witness the highs and lows of the camel racing industry through their eyes.

\r\n\r\n

Karim Ali is a documentary filmmaker who studied Media Management at the Arab Academy for Science, Technology, and Maritime Transport in Alexandria, Egypt. His debut short film, Airplane Mode (2017), was set in Dahab, South Sinai. His second documentary, The Children Behind Zalaga (2023), has been selected for the IDFA Festival 2023 and Vision du Réel 2024.

\r\n\r\n

Latin Love proudly invites you to it's biweekly SBK night at one of the most elegant spots. 

\r\n\r\n

Get ready for an unforgettable night of dance and music! Join us this Monday, December 23rd, for a FREE Bachata Partner-Work Workshop with the Latin Love Team Hussein, Hadia & Malak, from 9 to 10 PM. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced dancer, this workshop will bring out your best Bachata vibes! 

\r\n\r\n

\r\n Location: Minglings Restobar [Heliopolis]
\r\n Address: 58 Beirut, Almazah, Heliopolis.

\r\n\r\n

Free Bachata Workshop from 9:00 to 10:00 PM

Meet people, make friends and speak a lot of language with BlaBla Cairo
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------
\r\n HOW OUR EVENTS WORK 
\r\n It's very easy.
\r\nWe always start our events in  English and / or the local language. Then, once two or three people want to speak the same language, it will be possible to create a new linguistic group. For example if 2 or 3 people wish to speak French, we will create a group in  French .
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Yes, you can arrive late! Maximum 45min after the start of the event. However, being on time is greatly appreciated.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Our events are free; however, each participant shares in the space's rent.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 /  By participating in our events, you agree to be photographed and / or filmed. The photos and videos will be shared on our social networks and may be used for commercial purposes. You can also post your own photos with the #BlaBlaSelfie and #BlaBlaLanguageExchange HTag
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 This event does not welcome children, even accompanied by parents

The Children Behind Zalaga

\r\n\r\n

A Documentary by Karim Ali | 2023 | 65 min | Egypt | In Arabic with English subtitles

\r\n\r\n

Every year in South Sinai, young jockeys are chosen to compete in the Zalaga race—the oldest camel race in Egypt. This gripping documentary offers an intimate look at the child camel racers of South Sinai, highlighting the centuries-old Bedouin tradition that fuels their dreams of success. From wealthy investors to skilled trainers, and young jockeys who sacrifice their education for financial support, witness the highs and lows of the camel racing industry through their eyes.

\r\n\r\n

Karim Ali is a documentary filmmaker who studied Media Management at the Arab Academy for Science, Technology, and Maritime Transport in Alexandria, Egypt. His debut short film, Airplane Mode (2017), was set in Dahab, South Sinai. His second documentary, The Children Behind Zalaga (2023), has been selected for the IDFA Festival 2023 and Vision du Réel 2024.

\r\n\r\n

Folklorita: Reviving Egyptian Heritage @ MASQ

\r\n\r\n

 Date: Saturday, 18 January 2024
\r\n Time: 4:00 PM – 5:00 PM
\r\n Location: Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey

\r\n\r\n

Join us for an enchanting evening of traditional Egyptian music as Folklorita takes the stage at the historic Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey. This concert is part of the "Heritage for the People" series, celebrating the fusion of heritage and community development.

\r\n\r\n

Folklorita, an Egyptian musical ensemble founded in 2024, breathes new life into traditional folklore with a contemporary twist. Their performances have garnered acclaim for revitalising Egypt's rich musical heritage.

\r\n\r\n

The Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey, a historic Sufi complex from 1519-1524, was restored by ARCHiNOS in 2018-2019 with EU funding. Now is part of MASQ (Multicultural and Artistic Space at Qaitbey's) and operated by the Sultan Foundation, it serves as a cultural hub hosting Egyptian and international arts events alongside community programs.

\r\n\r\n

Don't miss this unique opportunity to experience the harmonious blend of Egypt's musical traditions within a historic setting. Mark your calendars and join us for an unforgettable cultural experience.

Dear Family's and friends

\r\n\r\n

HAPPY NEW YEAR 2025

\r\n\r\n

We are pleased to announce the grand opening of our new guest house, the Pyramids Temple Guest House. We have put in a lot of effort and thought into creating a place that offers comfort, convenience, and a touch of Egyptian charm.

\r\n\r\n

We would be honored if you could join us for the opening party on 31 Dec 2024, from 9 pm to 1 Am.
\r\nWe promise an evening of good company, delicious Egyptian sweets, and refreshing beverages, including water and soft drinks. You are also welcome to bring along any drink with you.

\r\n\r\n

Feel free to extend this invitation to your family and friends. The more, the merrier!

\r\n\r\n

We look forward to welcoming you to our guest house and sharing a memorable evening of New Year 2025

\r\n\r\n

Best Regards
\r\nPyramids Temple Guest House

", "address": null, "days": null, "platform": null, "format": false, "is_active": true, "cancellation_policy": null, "view_count": 10, "created_at": "2024-12-24T22:09:05.000000Z", "updated_at": "2025-01-11T11:19:58.000000Z" }, { "id": 61, "category_id": 39, "sub_category_id": null, "city_id": 14, "currency_id": 5, "company_id": null, "ad_fee_id": null, "name": "NVICinema : The Children Behind Zalaga", "upload_by": "myevnt", "organized_by": "NVIC - Netherlands-Flemish Institute in Cairo", "location": "1, Dr. Mahmoud Azmi Street, Zamalek, Egypt, 11211", "description": "

The Children Behind Zalaga

\r\n\r\n

A Documentary by Karim Ali | 2023 | 65 min | Egypt | In Arabic with English subtitles

\r\n\r\n

Every year in South Sinai, young jockeys are chosen to compete in the Zalaga race—the oldest camel race in Egypt. This gripping documentary offers an intimate look at the child camel racers of South Sinai, highlighting the centuries-old Bedouin tradition that fuels their dreams of success. From wealthy investors to skilled trainers, and young jockeys who sacrifice their education for financial support, witness the highs and lows of the camel racing industry through their eyes.

\r\n\r\n

Karim Ali is a documentary filmmaker who studied Media Management at the Arab Academy for Science, Technology, and Maritime Transport in Alexandria, Egypt. His debut short film, Airplane Mode (2017), was set in Dahab, South Sinai. His second documentary, The Children Behind Zalaga (2023), has been selected for the IDFA Festival 2023 and Vision du Réel 2024.

\r\n\r\n

Founders Live is back for another Cairo event!

\r\n\r\n

Join us for an incredible evening…

\r\n\r\n

Founders Live is an unforgettable happy hour competition sweeping the globe.

\r\n\r\n

5 founders

\r\n\r\n

99-second pitches

\r\n\r\n

4 minutes of audience Q&A

\r\n\r\n

YOUR VOTES decide the winner!

\r\n\r\n

\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------
\r\n HOW OUR EVENTS WORK 
\r\n It's very easy.
\r\nWe always start our events in  English and / or the local language. Then, once two or three people want to speak the same language, it will be possible to create a new linguistic group. For example if 2 or 3 people wish to speak French, we will create a group in  French .
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Yes, you can arrive late! Maximum 45min after the start of the event. However, being on time is greatly appreciated.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Our events are free; however, each participant shares in the space's rent.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 /  By participating in our events, you agree to be photographed and / or filmed. The photos and videos will be shared on our social networks and may be used for commercial purposes. You can also post your own photos with the #BlaBlaSelfie and #BlaBlaLanguageExchange HTag
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 This event does not welcome children, even accompanied by parents

The Children Behind Zalaga

\r\n\r\n

A Documentary by Karim Ali | 2023 | 65 min | Egypt | In Arabic with English subtitles

\r\n\r\n

Every year in South Sinai, young jockeys are chosen to compete in the Zalaga race—the oldest camel race in Egypt. This gripping documentary offers an intimate look at the child camel racers of South Sinai, highlighting the centuries-old Bedouin tradition that fuels their dreams of success. From wealthy investors to skilled trainers, and young jockeys who sacrifice their education for financial support, witness the highs and lows of the camel racing industry through their eyes.

\r\n\r\n

Karim Ali is a documentary filmmaker who studied Media Management at the Arab Academy for Science, Technology, and Maritime Transport in Alexandria, Egypt. His debut short film, Airplane Mode (2017), was set in Dahab, South Sinai. His second documentary, The Children Behind Zalaga (2023), has been selected for the IDFA Festival 2023 and Vision du Réel 2024.

\r\n\r\n

Dear Family's and friends

\r\n\r\n

HAPPY NEW YEAR 2025

\r\n\r\n

We are pleased to announce the grand opening of our new guest house, the Pyramids Temple Guest House. We have put in a lot of effort and thought into creating a place that offers comfort, convenience, and a touch of Egyptian charm.

\r\n\r\n

We would be honored if you could join us for the opening party on 31 Dec 2024, from 9 pm to 1 Am.
\r\nWe promise an evening of good company, delicious Egyptian sweets, and refreshing beverages, including water and soft drinks. You are also welcome to bring along any drink with you.

\r\n\r\n

\r\n\r\n

\r\n\r\n

Best Regards
\r\nPyramids Temple Guest House

{ "data": [ { "id": 51, "name": "latin night x minglings", "description": "

Latin Love proudly invites you to it's biweekly SBK night at one of the most elegant spots. 

\r\n\r\n

Get ready for an unforgettable night of dance and music! Join us this Monday, December 23rd, for a FREE Bachata Partner-Work Workshop with the Latin Love Team Hussein, Hadia & Malak, from 9 to 10 PM. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced dancer, this workshop will bring out your best Bachata vibes! 

\r\n\r\n

 Date: Monday, 23rd of December 2024.
\r\n Location: Minglings Restobar [Heliopolis]
\r\n Address: 58 Beirut, Almazah, Heliopolis.

Dear Family's and friends

\r\n\r\n

HAPPY NEW YEAR 2025

\r\n\r\n

We are pleased to announce the grand opening of our new guest house, the Pyramids Temple Guest House. We have put in a lot of effort and thought into creating a place that offers comfort, convenience, and a touch of Egyptian charm.

\r\n\r\n

We would be honored if you could join us for the opening party on 31 Dec 2024, from 9 pm to 1 Am.
\r\nWe promise an evening of good company, delicious Egyptian sweets, and refreshing beverages, including water and soft drinks. You are also welcome to bring along any drink with you.

\r\n\r\n

Feel free to extend this invitation to your family and friends. The more, the merrier!

\r\n\r\n

We look forward to welcoming you to our guest house and sharing a memorable evening of New Year 2025

\r\n\r\n

Best Regards
\r\nPyramids Temple Guest House

We are pleased to announce the grand opening of our new guest house, the Pyramids Temple Guest House. We have put in a lot of effort and thought into creating a place that offers comfort, convenience, and a touch of Egyptian charm.

\r\n\r\n

We would be honored if you could join us for the opening party on 31 Dec 2024, from 9 pm to 1 Am.
\r\nWe promise an evening of good company, delicious Egyptian sweets, and refreshing beverages, including water and soft drinks. You are also welcome to bring along any drink with you.

\r\n\r\n

Feel free to extend this invitation to your family and friends. The more, the merrier!

\r\n\r\n

We look forward to welcoming you to our guest house and sharing a memorable evening of New Year 2025

\r\n\r\n

Best Regards
\r\nPyramids Temple Guest House

The Children Behind Zalaga

\r\n\r\n

A Documentary by Karim Ali | 2023 | 65 min | Egypt | In Arabic with English subtitles

\r\n\r\n

Every year in South Sinai, young jockeys are chosen to compete in the Zalaga race—the oldest camel race in Egypt. This gripping documentary offers an intimate look at the child camel racers of South Sinai, highlighting the centuries-old Bedouin tradition that fuels their dreams of success. From wealthy investors to skilled trainers, and young jockeys who sacrifice their education for financial support, witness the highs and lows of the camel racing industry through their eyes.

\r\n\r\n

Karim Ali is a documentary filmmaker who studied Media Management at the Arab Academy for Science, Technology, and Maritime Transport in Alexandria, Egypt. His debut short film, Airplane Mode (2017), was set in Dahab, South Sinai. His second documentary, The Children Behind Zalaga (2023), has been selected for the IDFA Festival 2023 and Vision du Réel 2024.

\r\n\r\n

Meet people, make friends and speak a lot of language with BlaBla Cairo
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------
\r\n HOW OUR EVENTS WORK 
\r\n It's very easy.
\r\nWe always start our events in  English and / or the local language. Then, once two or three people want to speak the same language, it will be possible to create a new linguistic group. For example if 2 or 3 people wish to speak French, we will create a group in  French .
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Yes, you can arrive late! Maximum 45min after the start of the event. However, being on time is greatly appreciated.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Our events are free; however, each participant shares in the space's rent.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 /  By participating in our events, you agree to be photographed and / or filmed. The photos and videos will be shared on our social networks and may be used for commercial purposes. You can also post your own photos with the #BlaBlaSelfie and #BlaBlaLanguageExchange HTag
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 This event does not welcome children, even accompanied by parents

The Children Behind Zalaga

\r\n\r\n

A Documentary by Karim Ali | 2023 | 65 min | Egypt | In Arabic with English subtitles

\r\n\r\n

Every year in South Sinai, young jockeys are chosen to compete in the Zalaga race—the oldest camel race in Egypt. This gripping documentary offers an intimate look at the child camel racers of South Sinai, highlighting the centuries-old Bedouin tradition that fuels their dreams of success. From wealthy investors to skilled trainers, and young jockeys who sacrifice their education for financial support, witness the highs and lows of the camel racing industry through their eyes.

\r\n\r\n

Karim Ali is a documentary filmmaker who studied Media Management at the Arab Academy for Science, Technology, and Maritime Transport in Alexandria, Egypt. His debut short film, Airplane Mode (2017), was set in Dahab, South Sinai. His second documentary, The Children Behind Zalaga (2023), has been selected for the IDFA Festival 2023 and Vision du Réel 2024.

\r\n\r\n

The Children Behind Zalaga

\r\n\r\n

A Documentary by Karim Ali | 2023 | 65 min | Egypt | In Arabic with English subtitles

\r\n\r\n

Every year in South Sinai, young jockeys are chosen to compete in the Zalaga race—the oldest camel race in Egypt. This gripping documentary offers an intimate look at the child camel racers of South Sinai, highlighting the centuries-old Bedouin tradition that fuels their dreams of success. From wealthy investors to skilled trainers, and young jockeys who sacrifice their education for financial support, witness the highs and lows of the camel racing industry through their eyes.

\r\n\r\n

Karim Ali is a documentary filmmaker who studied Media Management at the Arab Academy for Science, Technology, and Maritime Transport in Alexandria, Egypt. His debut short film, Airplane Mode (2017), was set in Dahab, South Sinai. His second documentary, The Children Behind Zalaga (2023), has been selected for the IDFA Festival 2023 and Vision du Réel 2024.

\r\n\r\n

Meet people, make friends and speak a lot of language with BlaBla Cairo
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------
\r\n HOW OUR EVENTS WORK 
\r\n It's very easy.
\r\nWe always start our events in  English and / or the local language. Then, once two or three people want to speak the same language, it will be possible to create a new linguistic group. For example if 2 or 3 people wish to speak French, we will create a group in  French .
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Yes, you can arrive late! Maximum 45min after the start of the event. However, being on time is greatly appreciated.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Our events are free; however, each participant shares in the space's rent.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 /  By participating in our events, you agree to be photographed and / or filmed. The photos and videos will be shared on our social networks and may be used for commercial purposes. You can also post your own photos with the #BlaBlaSelfie and #BlaBlaLanguageExchange HTag
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 This event does not welcome children, even accompanied by parents

The Children Behind Zalaga

\r\n\r\n

A Documentary by Karim Ali | 2023 | 65 min | Egypt | In Arabic with English subtitles

\r\n\r\n

Every year in South Sinai, young jockeys are chosen to compete in the Zalaga race—the oldest camel race in Egypt. This gripping documentary offers an intimate look at the child camel racers of South Sinai, highlighting the centuries-old Bedouin tradition that fuels their dreams of success. From wealthy investors to skilled trainers, and young jockeys who sacrifice their education for financial support, witness the highs and lows of the camel racing industry through their eyes.

\r\n\r\n

Karim Ali is a documentary filmmaker who studied Media Management at the Arab Academy for Science, Technology, and Maritime Transport in Alexandria, Egypt. His debut short film, Airplane Mode (2017), was set in Dahab, South Sinai. His second documentary, The Children Behind Zalaga (2023), has been selected for the IDFA Festival 2023 and Vision du Réel 2024.

\r\n\r\n

Meet people, make friends and speak a lot of language with BlaBla Cairo
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------
\r\n HOW OUR EVENTS WORK 
\r\n It's very easy.
\r\nWe always start our events in  English and / or the local language. Then, once two or three people want to speak the same language, it will be possible to create a new linguistic group. For example if 2 or 3 people wish to speak French, we will create a group in  French .
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Yes, you can arrive late! Maximum 45min after the start of the event. However, being on time is greatly appreciated.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Our events are free; however, each participant shares in the space's rent.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 /  By participating in our events, you agree to be photographed and / or filmed. The photos and videos will be shared on our social networks and may be used for commercial purposes. You can also post your own photos with the #BlaBlaSelfie and #BlaBlaLanguageExchange HTag
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 This event does not welcome children, even accompanied by parents

Folklorita: Reviving Egyptian Heritage @ MASQ

\r\n\r\n

 Date: Saturday, 18 January 2024
\r\n Time: 4:00 PM – 5:00 PM
\r\n Location: Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey

\r\n\r\n

Join us for an enchanting evening of traditional Egyptian music as Folklorita takes the stage at the historic Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey. This concert is part of the "Heritage for the People" series, celebrating the fusion of heritage and community development.

\r\n\r\n

Folklorita, an Egyptian musical ensemble founded in 2024, breathes new life into traditional folklore with a contemporary twist. Their performances have garnered acclaim for revitalising Egypt's rich musical heritage.

\r\n\r\n

The Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey, a historic Sufi complex from 1519-1524, was restored by ARCHiNOS in 2018-2019 with EU funding. Now is part of MASQ (Multicultural and Artistic Space at Qaitbey's) and operated by the Sultan Foundation, it serves as a cultural hub hosting Egyptian and international arts events alongside community programs.

\r\n\r\n

Don't miss this unique opportunity to experience the harmonious blend of Egypt's musical traditions within a historic setting. Mark your calendars and join us for an unforgettable cultural experience.

", "address": null, "days": null, "platform": null, "format": false, "is_active": true, "cancellation_policy": null, "external_link": null, "view_count": 41, "created_at": "2024-12-25T00:09:05.000000Z", "updated_at": "2025-02-25T11:16:12.000000Z" }, { "id": 61, "category_id": 39, "sub_category_id": null, "city_id": 14, "currency_id": 5, "company_id": null, "ad_fee_id": null, "name": "NVICinema : The Children Behind Zalaga", "upload_by": "myevnt", "organized_by": "NVIC - Netherlands-Flemish Institute in Cairo", "location": "1, Dr. Mahmoud Azmi Street, Zamalek, Egypt, 11211", "description": "

The Children Behind Zalaga

\r\n\r\n

A Documentary by Karim Ali | 2023 | 65 min | Egypt | In Arabic with English subtitles

\r\n\r\n

Every year in South Sinai, young jockeys are chosen to compete in the Zalaga race—the oldest camel race in Egypt. This gripping documentary offers an intimate look at the child camel racers of South Sinai, highlighting the centuries-old Bedouin tradition that fuels their dreams of success. From wealthy investors to skilled trainers, and young jockeys who sacrifice their education for financial support, witness the highs and lows of the camel racing industry through their eyes.

\r\n\r\n

Karim Ali is a documentary filmmaker who studied Media Management at the Arab Academy for Science, Technology, and Maritime Transport in Alexandria, Egypt. His debut short film, Airplane Mode (2017), was set in Dahab, South Sinai. His second documentary, The Children Behind Zalaga (2023), has been selected for the IDFA Festival 2023 and Vision du Réel 2024.

\r\n\r\n

Meet people, make friends and speak a lot of language with BlaBla Cairo
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------
\r\n HOW OUR EVENTS WORK 
\r\n It's very easy.
\r\nWe always start our events in  English and / or the local language. Then, once two or three people want to speak the same language, it will be possible to create a new linguistic group. For example if 2 or 3 people wish to speak French, we will create a group in  French .
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Yes, you can arrive late! Maximum 45min after the start of the event. However, being on time is greatly appreciated.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Our events are free; however, each participant shares in the space's rent.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 /  By participating in our events, you agree to be photographed and / or filmed. The photos and videos will be shared on our social networks and may be used for commercial purposes. You can also post your own photos with the #BlaBlaSelfie and #BlaBlaLanguageExchange HTag
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 This event does not welcome children, even accompanied by parents

Welcome to Earth Astrology ORACLE: Insights on the Astrological Year ahead!

\r\n\r\n

Join us for an exciting virtual tour of the key themes of the astrological year ahead -- March 21 2025 to March 21 2026 -- the most dramatic and historic year of our lifetimes!

\r\n\r\n

Astrologer David Nicol will share insights on the historic nature of the passage just ahead, offer practices and guidance for energetic alignment, and lead a live experiential transmission. Don't miss this opportunity to connect with astrology lovers worldwide and prepare yourself for the huge changes to come.

Join us for the 3rd Annual Conference on Aesthetic Gynecology, organized by IAAUG, where we bring together leading experts and practitioners from around the world. This prestigious event will feature evidence-based discussions on some of the most debated and controversial topics within obstetrics and gynecology, with a special focus on aesthetic gynecology.
\r\n
\r\nWe warmly welcome doctors and specialists from across the globe to engage in cutting-edge scientific sessions, share knowledge, and connect with renowned international speakers.
\r\n
\r\nDon't miss this opportunity to be part of a transformative experience in the field of aesthetic gynecology! We look forward to seeing you there.

Dear Family's and friends

\r\n\r\n

HAPPY NEW YEAR 2025

\r\n\r\n

We are pleased to announce the grand opening of our new guest house, the Pyramids Temple Guest House. We have put in a lot of effort and thought into creating a place that offers comfort, convenience, and a touch of Egyptian charm.

\r\n\r\n

We would be honored if you could join us for the opening party on 31 Dec 2024, from 9 pm to 1 Am.
\r\nWe promise an evening of good company, delicious Egyptian sweets, and refreshing beverages, including water and soft drinks. You are also welcome to bring along any drink with you.

\r\n\r\n

Feel free to extend this invitation to your family and friends. The more, the merrier!

\r\n\r\n

We look forward to welcoming you to our guest house and sharing a memorable evening of New Year 2025

\r\n\r\n

Meet people, make friends and speak a lot of language with BlaBla Cairo
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------
\r\n HOW OUR EVENTS WORK 
\r\n It's very easy.
\r\nWe always start our events in  English and / or the local language. Then, once two or three people want to speak the same language, it will be possible to create a new linguistic group. For example if 2 or 3 people wish to speak French, we will create a group in  French .
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Yes, you can arrive late! Maximum 45min after the start of the event. However, being on time is greatly appreciated.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Our events are free; however, each participant shares in the space's rent.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 /  By participating in our events, you agree to be photographed and / or filmed. The photos and videos will be shared on our social networks and may be used for commercial purposes. You can also post your own photos with the #BlaBlaSelfie and #BlaBlaLanguageExchange HTag
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 This event does not welcome children, even accompanied by parents

\r\nYou're invited to attend an exhibition dedicated to handmade art and authentic crafts, which is considered the largest gathering of craftsmen and creative people in Egypt. We will present various products that combine creativity and quality to you.
\r\nLocation: Fustat Market, Old Egypt https://maps.app.goo.gl/gjMHHXCr9M8EZLhg6 

\r\n\r\n

Free Bachata Workshop from 9:00 to 10:00 PM

Meet people, make friends and speak a lot of language with BlaBla Cairo
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------
\r\n HOW OUR EVENTS WORK 
\r\n It's very easy.
\r\nWe always start our events in  English and / or the local language. Then, once two or three people want to speak the same language, it will be possible to create a new linguistic group. For example if 2 or 3 people wish to speak French, we will create a group in  French .
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Yes, you can arrive late! Maximum 45min after the start of the event. However, being on time is greatly appreciated.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Our events are free; however, each participant shares in the space's rent.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 /  By participating in our events, you agree to be photographed and / or filmed. The photos and videos will be shared on our social networks and may be used for commercial purposes. You can also post your own photos with the #BlaBlaSelfie and #BlaBlaLanguageExchange HTag
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

{ "data": [ { "id": 51, "name": "latin night x minglings", "description": "

Latin Love proudly invites you to it's biweekly SBK night at one of the most elegant spots. 

\r\n\r\n

Get ready for an unforgettable night of dance and music! Join us this Monday, December 23rd, for a FREE Bachata Partner-Work Workshop with the Latin Love Team Hussein, Hadia & Malak, from 9 to 10 PM. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced dancer, this workshop will bring out your best Bachata vibes! 

\r\n\r\n

 Date: Monday, 23rd of December 2024.
\r\n Location: Minglings Restobar [Heliopolis]
\r\n Address: 58 Beirut, Almazah, Heliopolis.

\r\n\r\n

Free Bachata Workshop from 9:00 to 10:00 PM

Dear Family's and friends

\r\n\r\n

HAPPY NEW YEAR 2025

\r\n\r\n

We are pleased to announce the grand opening of our new guest house, the Pyramids Temple Guest House. We have put in a lot of effort and thought into creating a place that offers comfort, convenience, and a touch of Egyptian charm.

\r\n\r\n

We would be honored if you could join us for the opening party on 31 Dec 2024, from 9 pm to 1 Am.
\r\nWe promise an evening of good company, delicious Egyptian sweets, and refreshing beverages, including water and soft drinks. You are also welcome to bring along any drink with you.

\r\n\r\n

Feel free to extend this invitation to your family and friends. The more, the merrier!

\r\n\r\n

We look forward to welcoming you to our guest house and sharing a memorable evening of New Year 2025

\r\n\r\n

Best Regards
\r\nPyramids Temple Guest House

Meet people, make friends and speak a lot of language with BlaBla Cairo
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------
\r\n HOW OUR EVENTS WORK 
\r\n It's very easy.
\r\nWe always start our events in  English and / or the local language. Then, once two or three people want to speak the same language, it will be possible to create a new linguistic group. For example if 2 or 3 people wish to speak French, we will create a group in  French .
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Yes, you can arrive late! Maximum 45min after the start of the event. However, being on time is greatly appreciated.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Our events are free; however, each participant shares in the space's rent.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 /  By participating in our events, you agree to be photographed and / or filmed. The photos and videos will be shared on our social networks and may be used for commercial purposes. You can also post your own photos with the #BlaBlaSelfie and #BlaBlaLanguageExchange HTag
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 This event does not welcome children, even accompanied by parents

Latin Love proudly invites you to it's biweekly SBK night at one of the most elegant spots. 

\r\n\r\n

Get ready for an unforgettable night of dance and music! Join us this Monday, December 23rd, for a FREE Bachata Partner-Work Workshop with the Latin Love Team Hussein, Hadia & Malak, from 9 to 10 PM. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced dancer, this workshop will bring out your best Bachata vibes! 

\r\n\r\n

 Date: Monday, 23rd of December 2024.
\r\n Location: Minglings Restobar [Heliopolis]
\r\n Address: 58 Beirut, Almazah, Heliopolis.

\r\n\r\n

Free Bachata Workshop from 9:00 to 10:00 PM

Dear Family's and friends

\r\n\r\n

HAPPY NEW YEAR 2025

\r\n\r\n

We are pleased to announce the grand opening of our new guest house, the Pyramids Temple Guest House. We have put in a lot of effort and thought into creating a place that offers comfort, convenience, and a touch of Egyptian charm.

\r\n\r\n

We would be honored if you could join us for the opening party on 31 Dec 2024, from 9 pm to 1 Am.
\r\nWe promise an evening of good company, delicious Egyptian sweets, and refreshing beverages, including water and soft drinks. You are also welcome to bring along any drink with you.

\r\n\r\n

Feel free to extend this invitation to your family and friends. The more, the merrier!

\r\n\r\n

We look forward to welcoming you to our guest house and sharing a memorable evening of New Year 2025

\r\n\r\n

Best Regards
\r\nPyramids Temple Guest House

Meet people, make friends and speak a lot of language with BlaBla Cairo
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------
\r\n HOW OUR EVENTS WORK 
\r\n It's very easy.
\r\nWe always start our events in  English and / or the local language. Then, once two or three people want to speak the same language, it will be possible to create a new linguistic group. For example if 2 or 3 people wish to speak French, we will create a group in  French .
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Yes, you can arrive late! Maximum 45min after the start of the event. However, being on time is greatly appreciated.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Our events are free; however, each participant shares in the space's rent.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 /  By participating in our events, you agree to be photographed and / or filmed. The photos and videos will be shared on our social networks and may be used for commercial purposes. You can also post your own photos with the #BlaBlaSelfie and #BlaBlaLanguageExchange HTag
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 This event does not welcome children, even accompanied by parents

{ "data": [ { "id": 51, "name": "latin night x minglings", "description": "

Latin Love proudly invites you to it's biweekly SBK night at one of the most elegant spots. 

\r\n\r\n

Get ready for an unforgettable night of dance and music! Join us this Monday, December 23rd, for a FREE Bachata Partner-Work Workshop with the Latin Love Team Hussein, Hadia & Malak, from 9 to 10 PM. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced dancer, this workshop will bring out your best Bachata vibes! 

\r\n\r\n

 Date: Monday, 23rd of December 2024.
\r\n Location: Minglings Restobar [Heliopolis]
\r\n Address: 58 Beirut, Almazah, Heliopolis.

\r\n\r\n

Free Bachata Workshop from 9:00 to 10:00 PM

Dear Family's and friends

\r\n\r\n

HAPPY NEW YEAR 2025

\r\n\r\n

We are pleased to announce the grand opening of our new guest house, the Pyramids Temple Guest House. We have put in a lot of effort and thought into creating a place that offers comfort, convenience, and a touch of Egyptian charm.

\r\n\r\n

We would be honored if you could join us for the opening party on 31 Dec 2024, from 9 pm to 1 Am.
\r\nWe promise an evening of good company, delicious Egyptian sweets, and refreshing beverages, including water and soft drinks. You are also welcome to bring along any drink with you.

\r\n\r\n

Feel free to extend this invitation to your family and friends. The more, the merrier!

\r\n\r\n

We look forward to welcoming you to our guest house and sharing a memorable evening of New Year 2025

\r\n\r\n

Best Regards
\r\nPyramids Temple Guest House

Meet people, make friends and speak a lot of language with BlaBla Cairo
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------
\r\n HOW OUR EVENTS WORK 
\r\n It's very easy.
\r\nWe always start our events in  English and / or the local language. Then, once two or three people want to speak the same language, it will be possible to create a new linguistic group. For example if 2 or 3 people wish to speak French, we will create a group in  French .
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Yes, you can arrive late! Maximum 45min after the start of the event. However, being on time is greatly appreciated.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 Our events are free; however, each participant shares in the space's rent.
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 /  By participating in our events, you agree to be photographed and / or filmed. The photos and videos will be shared on our social networks and may be used for commercial purposes. You can also post your own photos with the #BlaBlaSelfie and #BlaBlaLanguageExchange HTag
\r\n--------------------------------------------------------------------------

\r\n\r\n

 This event does not welcome children, even accompanied by parents

Folklorita: Reviving Egyptian Heritage @ MASQ

\r\n\r\n

 Date: Saturday, 18 January 2024
\r\n Time: 4:00 PM – 5:00 PM
\r\n Location: Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey

\r\n\r\n

Join us for an enchanting evening of traditional Egyptian music as Folklorita takes the stage at the historic Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey. This concert is part of the "Heritage for the People" series, celebrating the fusion of heritage and community development.

\r\n\r\n

Folklorita, an Egyptian musical ensemble founded in 2024, breathes new life into traditional folklore with a contemporary twist. Their performances have garnered acclaim for revitalising Egypt's rich musical heritage.

\r\n\r\n

The Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey, a historic Sufi complex from 1519-1524, was restored by ARCHiNOS in 2018-2019 with EU funding. Now is part of MASQ (Multicultural and Artistic Space at Qaitbey's) and operated by the Sultan Foundation, it serves as a cultural hub hosting Egyptian and international arts events alongside community programs.

\r\n\r\n

Don't miss this unique opportunity to experience the harmonious blend of Egypt's musical traditions within a historic setting. Mark your calendars and join us for an unforgettable cultural experience.

Folklorita: Reviving Egyptian Heritage @ MASQ

\r\n\r\n

 Date: Saturday, 18 January 2024
\r\n Time: 4:00 PM – 5:00 PM
\r\n Location: Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey

\r\n\r\n

Join us for an enchanting evening of traditional Egyptian music as Folklorita takes the stage at the historic Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey. This concert is part of the "Heritage for the People" series, celebrating the fusion of heritage and community development.

\r\n\r\n

Folklorita, an Egyptian musical ensemble founded in 2024, breathes new life into traditional folklore with a contemporary twist. Their performances have garnered acclaim for revitalising Egypt's rich musical heritage.

\r\n\r\n

The Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey, a historic Sufi complex from 1519-1524, was restored by ARCHiNOS in 2018-2019 with EU funding. Now is part of MASQ (Multicultural and Artistic Space at Qaitbey's) and operated by the Sultan Foundation, it serves as a cultural hub hosting Egyptian and international arts events alongside community programs.

\r\n\r\n

Don't miss this unique opportunity to experience the harmonious blend of Egypt's musical traditions within a historic setting. Mark your calendars and join us for an unforgettable cultural experience.

Folklorita: Reviving Egyptian Heritage @ MASQ

\r\n\r\n

 Date: Saturday, 18 January 2024
\r\n Time: 4:00 PM – 5:00 PM
\r\n Location: Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey

\r\n\r\n

Join us for an enchanting evening of traditional Egyptian music as Folklorita takes the stage at the historic Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey. This concert is part of the "Heritage for the People" series, celebrating the fusion of heritage and community development.

\r\n\r\n

Folklorita, an Egyptian musical ensemble founded in 2024, breathes new life into traditional folklore with a contemporary twist. Their performances have garnered acclaim for revitalising Egypt's rich musical heritage.

\r\n\r\n

The Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey, a historic Sufi complex from 1519-1524, was restored by ARCHiNOS in 2018-2019 with EU funding. Now is part of MASQ (Multicultural and Artistic Space at Qaitbey's) and operated by the Sultan Foundation, it serves as a cultural hub hosting Egyptian and international arts events alongside community programs.

\r\n\r\n

Don't miss this unique opportunity to experience the harmonious blend of Egypt's musical traditions within a historic setting. Mark your calendars and join us for an unforgettable cultural experience.

Folklorita: Reviving Egyptian Heritage @ MASQ

\r\n\r\n

 Date: Saturday, 18 January 2024
\r\n Time: 4:00 PM – 5:00 PM
\r\n Location: Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey

\r\n\r\n

Join us for an enchanting evening of traditional Egyptian music as Folklorita takes the stage at the historic Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey. This concert is part of the "Heritage for the People" series, celebrating the fusion of heritage and community development.

\r\n\r\n

Folklorita, an Egyptian musical ensemble founded in 2024, breathes new life into traditional folklore with a contemporary twist. Their performances have garnered acclaim for revitalising Egypt's rich musical heritage.

\r\n\r\n

The Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey, a historic Sufi complex from 1519-1524, was restored by ARCHiNOS in 2018-2019 with EU funding. Now is part of MASQ (Multicultural and Artistic Space at Qaitbey's) and operated by the Sultan Foundation, it serves as a cultural hub hosting Egyptian and international arts events alongside community programs.

\r\n\r\n

Don't miss this unique opportunity to experience the harmonious blend of Egypt's musical traditions within a historic setting. Mark your calendars and join us for an unforgettable cultural experience.

Folklorita: Reviving Egyptian Heritage @ MASQ

\r\n\r\n

 Date: Saturday, 18 January 2024
\r\n Time: 4:00 PM – 5:00 PM
\r\n Location: Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey

\r\n\r\n

Join us for an enchanting evening of traditional Egyptian music as Folklorita takes the stage at the historic Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey. This concert is part of the "Heritage for the People" series, celebrating the fusion of heritage and community development.

\r\n\r\n

Folklorita, an Egyptian musical ensemble founded in 2024, breathes new life into traditional folklore with a contemporary twist. Their performances have garnered acclaim for revitalising Egypt's rich musical heritage.

\r\n\r\n

The Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey, a historic Sufi complex from 1519-1524, was restored by ARCHiNOS in 2018-2019 with EU funding. Now is part of MASQ (Multicultural and Artistic Space at Qaitbey's) and operated by the Sultan Foundation, it serves as a cultural hub hosting Egyptian and international arts events alongside community programs.

\r\n\r\n

Don't miss this unique opportunity to experience the harmonious blend of Egypt's musical traditions within a historic setting. Mark your calendars and join us for an unforgettable cultural experience.

Folklorita: Reviving Egyptian Heritage @ MASQ

\r\n\r\n

 Date: Saturday, 18 January 2024
\r\n Time: 4:00 PM – 5:00 PM
\r\n Location: Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey

\r\n\r\n

Join us for an enchanting evening of traditional Egyptian music as Folklorita takes the stage at the historic Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey. This concert is part of the "Heritage for the People" series, celebrating the fusion of heritage and community development.

\r\n\r\n

Folklorita, an Egyptian musical ensemble founded in 2024, breathes new life into traditional folklore with a contemporary twist. Their performances have garnered acclaim for revitalising Egypt's rich musical heritage.

\r\n\r\n

The Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey, a historic Sufi complex from 1519-1524, was restored by ARCHiNOS in 2018-2019 with EU funding. Now is part of MASQ (Multicultural and Artistic Space at Qaitbey's) and operated by the Sultan Foundation, it serves as a cultural hub hosting Egyptian and international arts events alongside community programs.

\r\n\r\n

Don't miss this unique opportunity to experience the harmonious blend of Egypt's musical traditions within a historic setting. Mark your calendars and join us for an unforgettable cultural experience.

Folklorita: Reviving Egyptian Heritage @ MASQ

\r\n\r\n

 Date: Saturday, 18 January 2024
\r\n Time: 4:00 PM – 5:00 PM
\r\n Location: Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey

\r\n\r\n

Join us for an enchanting evening of traditional Egyptian music as Folklorita takes the stage at the historic Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey. This concert is part of the "Heritage for the People" series, celebrating the fusion of heritage and community development.

\r\n\r\n

Folklorita, an Egyptian musical ensemble founded in 2024, breathes new life into traditional folklore with a contemporary twist. Their performances have garnered acclaim for revitalising Egypt's rich musical heritage.

\r\n\r\n

The Maq'ad of Sultan Qaitbey, a historic Sufi complex from 1519-1524, was restored by ARCHiNOS in 2018-2019 with EU funding. Now is part of MASQ (Multicultural and Artistic Space at Qaitbey's) and operated by the Sultan Foundation, it serves as a cultural hub hosting Egyptian and international arts events alongside community programs.

\r\n\r\n

Don't miss this unique opportunity to experience the harmonious blend of Egypt's musical traditions within a historic setting. Mark your calendars and join us for an unforgettable cultural experience.

{ "data": { "id": 51, "name": "latin night x minglings", "description": "

Latin Love proudly invites you to it's biweekly SBK night at one of the most elegant spots. 

\r\n\r\n

Get ready for an unforgettable night of dance and music! Join us this Monday, December 23rd, for a FREE Bachata Partner-Work Workshop with the Latin Love Team Hussein, Hadia & Malak, from 9 to 10 PM. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced dancer, this workshop will bring out your best Bachata vibes! 

\r\n\r\n

 Date: Monday, 23rd of December 2024.
\r\n Location: Minglings Restobar [Heliopolis]
\r\n Address: 58 Beirut, Almazah, Heliopolis.
